page.title: 17THE TEA-SHOP OWNER, AYSGARTH
page.content: We went to talk to a local cafe owner and he told us about his day. We asked why he moved to Aysgarth. He said that there were no businesses of the same kind in the area. We asked him what he sold and he said he sold things like soup, hot chocolate, waffles with syrup on the top, fruit cake and Wensleydale Cheese and salads - they were the most common items. They open at 10.30 am in the summer and in the winter they open at weekends, and close when people go home. They are most busy at Easter. 4.00 pm is the busiest time of day. Deliveries come from Darlington, Ripon and Malton. They have a part-time baker. Michael owns two cafes; one is at the National Park Information Centre and the other one is near the bridge at Aysgarth Falls.
